article.title: Northrop Grumman to Provide ASIP Spare Hardware
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Northrop Grumman Space and Missions Systems Corporation, San Jose, California, is being awarded a $10,360,820 firm-fixed-price modification contract to procure spare hardware to support the Airborne Sigint Intelligence Payload Increment 1 software development task. A total of 26 unique spare items are to be procured. The hardware is required to repair and maintain lab and flight test support equipment during the Increment 1 development effort and future upgrade programs. Reconnaissance Systems Wing, Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, Ohio, is the contracting activity.
